newsitem.title: EGYPT: Mubarak says Cairo conference brought $10 billion.
newsitem.headline: Mubarak says Cairo conference brought $10 billion.

text.p: Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak said on Friday his country attracted $10 billion in investment during the Middle East economic conference which closed in Cairo on Thursday.
Mubarak gave the figure to newspaper editors who flew to Abu Dhabi with him on Friday, state television said.
"He said that the contracts and agreements signed during the conference for investment in Egypt came to $10 billion," the television quoted him as saying.
Egyptian Foreign Minister Amr Moussa and Klaus Schwab, president of the World Economic Forum, gave the same figure on Thursday for the value of all deals signed during the conference.
The amount is about 16 times the total direct foreign investment in Egypt during the financial year 1995/6 which ended last June.

The largest single deal publicised was a project to export Egyptian liquefied natural gas to Turkey, signed by Egypt, Turkey and the U.S. oil company Amoco. The project is expected to cost between $2 billion and $4 billion.
